product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
complaint:
I am submitting this complaint directly to you because CFPB has direct oversight over the Credit Reporting Agencies. XXXX, Transunion, and XXXX have allowed a charged-off account scheduled for automatic removal XX/XX/XXXX to remain on my credit report past the 7-year deadline governed by FCRA 605. XXXX XXXX  XXXX unlawfully re-aged this charged-off account # XXXX to estimated month and year of XX/XX/XXXX. 
This debt is from my XXXX XXXX XXXX Credit Card Number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, opened XXXX, expiration date XX/XX/XXXX. The charged-off and closed date of the account is documented on my credit report as XX/XX/XXXX. I am aware that XXXX as the original creditor does not appear once the account is charged-off and closed because the debt was sold to a collection agency. XXXX XXXX  XXXX is the new debt owner. I made some payments to XXXX. This payment activity does not constitute a new debt and change the original charge-off date by the original lender. It is incontestably a continuation of the original debt. Federal law requires collection agencies to carry over the original delinquency date so that any collection account is deleted at the same time of the 7-year period charged-off account. It is a violation of law for a collection agency to report and treat a charged-off and closed account as newer. XXXX added a second charge off date of XX/XX/XXXX to make the charge-off appear more recent. In XXXX, I disputed this information with Transunion via phone, stating XXXX intentional re-aging this account and referred to the original creditors charged-off date of XX/XX/XXXX listed on my credit report. Transunion contacted XXXX and XXXX verified the information. I made an additional call back to Transunion to rebut the verified information and again referred to the original charge-off date of XX/XX/XXXX. Transunion advised me that only the creditor could remove this from my report. FCRA 605 holds the Credit Reporting Agencies and the creditors responsible for complying with the law, but that law has been defiled. I do not intend to engage more of my time with the other two reporting agencies while my credit report continues to be damaged, knowing my efforts would generate the same result as with Transunion. I do not intend to engage any time with XXXX XXXX XXXX because of the they have recertified outright deceptive information as of XX/XX/XXXX. Further, XXXX XXXX   XXXX is reporting a second charged off date of XX/XX/XXXX. This malicious, illegal reporting has caused me immeasurable injury. 

American consumers deserve to be protected by the FCRA 605 law, and should not have to deal with the irresponsible reporting concomitant with automatic removal of charged-off and closed accounts. Creditors should be prohibited from submitting re-aged information to the CRAs that extends the 7-year period. Per FCRA 605. Requirements relating to information contained in consumer reports [ 15 U.S.C. 1681c ] ( a ) Information excluded from consumer reports. Except as authorized under subsection ( b ) of this section, no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : ( 4 ) Accounts placed for collection or charged to profit and loss which antedate the report by more than seven years. ( c ) Running of Reporting Period ( 1 ) In general.The 7-year period referred to in paragraphs ( 4 ) and ( 6 ) of subsection ( a ) shall begin, with respect to any delinquent account that is placed for collection ( internally or by referral to a third party, whichever is earlier ), charged to profit and loss, or subjected to any similar action, upon the expiration of the 180-day period beginning on the date of the commencement of the delinquency which immediately preceded the collection activity, charge to profit and loss, or similar action.

complaint: Around XX/XX/2017 I realized that someone I did not recognize sent money to my account, it was about between {$100.00} and {$200.00}. After this I was under the impression that this issue was rectified not knowing that this person was still sending me money on a monthly basis totaling {$800.00} after a year. I explained what has been going on to the agent doing the claim and she said that she would contact me but none did. The bank went ahead and took {$800.00} out of my account leaving me overdraft without notifying me or getting permission. The agent noted that I gave her permission to take the money out because I do not know the sender and we did not have that conversation. after I told her the situation, I was told that she will contact me back. when I called multiple times they were rude and not trying to hear out the situation. The last lady informed me that I should have been aware of this and not spend the money and I called last year to file a fraud claim which was denied because I cant file a fraud claim for receiving money even if it is from someone I don't know. complaint: I purchased a brand new XXXX Yamaha Wolverine R spec ( utv ) from my local yamaha dealer for roughly 15000 dollars on a loan when they first came out. I purchased an extended 4 year warranty through yamaha for full drive train coverage etc. after owning this machine for not even a year and  only having 1200 miles on it the motor went on a cold start one day. The dealer replaced everything from the crank up in the motor without figuring out why it went. This roughly cost 3500 dollars in parts and labor for yamaha i would assume. The dealer ran it around the building numerous times etc and i got it back in reasonable time. With all brand new parts the motor came apart again not even 150 miles later.. The dealer has pulled apart engine and wants to replace oil pump along with all new parts again but yamaha is refusing to cover the machine with over 2 years of warranty left. its clear that the machine has a lubrication issue within the motor yet are claiming this is all my fault. They went as far as offering me one part as good will and than sent me a cheesy sticker package in the mail. I still owe an outrageous amount of money on something i ca n't use. I had to cancel hunting trips etc and am still making all payments. The dealer has made numerous calls to Yamaha motors corporation only to have my claim denied time and time again. I have spent lots of my time on the phone and can not get any answers from the company. a person name XXXX with customer service has denied my claims and wo n't give me a direct answer about covering the machine. I feel that i am being treated very poorly and was sold a lemon that I 'm now stuck with. I 've owned numerous machines through this company and have never had an issue. I 've found other people with similar issues online from some of the first wolverines that were purchased, not sure on the outcome for them.
